solution_line_template: Traveling {travel_hours} hours due east at {speed_kph} kilometers per hour, the ship sailed {travel_hours}*{speed_kph}=<<{travel_hours}*{speed_kph}={eastward_distance}>>{eastward_distance} kilometers the first day.

If half the distance to the destination is {eastward_distance} kilometers, then 2*{eastward_distance}=<<2*{eastward_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} kilometers is the total distance from start to destination.
One-third of the distance from start to destination is {one_third_fraction} * {total_distance} = <<{total_distance}/3={one_third_distance}>>{one_third_distance} kilometers.
Thus, the wind storm blew the ship in a westward direction for {eastward_distance} - {one_third_distance} = <<{eastward_distance}-{one_third_distance}={blown_distance}>>{blown_distance} kilometers.
